availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Asa Bellow (Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Bellow. Father of Elizabeth Bellow, Mary Bellow, Lycurgus Bellow, Martha Bellow, Emeline Bellow, Narcissus William Bellow, Isabinda Bellow, and Mary Ann Bellow. Farmer in Carter County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Catlettsburg, Boyd County, Kentucky in 1860. Employed Hugh Hagerty as a laborer in Carter County, Kentucky in 1850. Employed John Hagerty as a laborer in Carter County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned one enslaved individual in Carter County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned four enslaved individuals in Boyd County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 228A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 734.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, p. 3.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct 6, p. 157B.
